sources.full: Whispers of The Arcane: The Bestiary

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Khorvuz wields a {@item staff of the magi} and he wears a {@item robe of the archmagi}. In addition, he wears a {@item ring of spell storing} containing a 5th-level {@spell magic missile} spell.

trait.name: Split Enchantment
entries: When Khorvuz casts an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, he can have it target a second creature.

trait.name: Alter Memories
entries: When Khorvuz casts an enchantment spell to charm one or more creatures, he can alter one creature's understanding so that it remains unaware of being {@condition charmed}.

Additionally, once before said spell expires, Khorvuz can use his action to try to make the chosen creature forget some of the time it spent {@condition charmed}. The creature must succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence saving throw or lose 4 hours of its memories. Khorvuz can make the creature forget less time, and the amount of time can't exceed the duration of the enchantment spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Khorvuz is a 15th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). He knows the following wizard spells, and prepared spells are marked with brackets.

action.name: Hypnotic Gaze
entries: Khorvuz chooses one creature within 5 feet of him that must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by Khorvuz until the end of his next turn. The {@condition charmed} creature's speed drops to 0, and the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and visibly dazed.

On subsequent turns, Khorvuz can use his action to maintain this effect, extending its duration until the end of his next turn. However, the effect ends if he moves more than 5 feet away from the creature, if the creature can neither see nor hear Khorvuz, or if the creature takes any form of damage.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm (Recharges after Khorvuz casts an Enchantment Spell of 1st level or higher)
entries: Khorvuz tries to magically divert an attack made against him, provided that the attacker is within 30 feet of him and visible to him. Khorvuz must decide to do so before the attack hits or misses.

The attacker must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature closest to it, other than Khorvuz or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Azran's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). Azran can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Azran is a 13th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). He knows the following wizard spells, and prepared spells are marked with brackets:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Azran carries a {@item Figurine of Wondrous Power, Silver Raven||Figurine of Wondrous Power (Silver Raven)}.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Azran has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put him to sleep.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Illusory Step (Recharges after the Illusionist Casts an Illusion Spell of 1st Level or Higher).
entries: Azran can create an illusory duplicate of himself as an instant, almost instinctual reaction to danger.

Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against Azran, he can use his reaction to interpose an illusory duplicate between the attacker and himself. The attack automatically misses, then the illusion dissapates.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Supergiant Collapse
entries: When the dragon dies, its body rapidly collapses in on itself, causing an impossibly powerful implosion that tears open a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the dragon died and is 10 feet in diameter. Each creature within 30 feet of the gate must succeed on a DC {@dc 26} Strength saving throw or take 55 (10d10) force damage and be sucked through the gate to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one way and can't be reopened.

trait.name: Undying Light
entries: The dragon perpetually sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet. This light is sunlight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its either its Frightful Presence or its Solar Flare. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Solar Flare
entries: The dragon emits a wave of overwhelmingly brilliant light. Each creature within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the turn.
In addition, roll a {@dice d6}. on a 6, the dragon can immediately use its Plasma Breath, regardless of whether it is charged or not; if it does so, it can't make attacks until the end of it's turn.

action.name: Plasma Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales a corona of solar energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Constitution saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage and 42 ({@damage 12d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Whether the saving throw is successful or not, a target can't take reactions until the end of the dragon's next turn.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Gravity Well (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon intensifies the gravitational pull around itself, concentrating it into a crushing force. Each creature of the dragon's choice within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 26} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) force damage and is pulled up to 30 feet toward the dragon. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.
